intro: Phyllostegia obatae, commonly known as the Florida stiltvane, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Phyllostegia obatae plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various insects.
